net.hudup.core.data

Interface Provider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProviderImpl

    public interface Provider
extends AutoCloseable, Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Dataset only provides read-only operations via "get" and "fetch" methods. Thus, Provider interface and its implementations support storage service in service layer to update and modify database via writing operations. Provider interacts directly with database, which is created in data layer. For example, updateRating(RatingVector) method saves rating values that user makes on items to database. Provider also provides read-only accesses to database. So, in many situations, Scanner uses Provider to retrieve information from database because Scanner does not store information in memory.
    Moreover, Provider manipulates context and context template via context template schema manager (CTS manager) represented by CTSManager. Provider provides most of read-write data operations (get, insert, update, delete). Provider uses provider associator represented by ProviderAssoc for low-level data operators. Every provider own a configuration represented by DataConfig for initialization (setting up).
    In general, provider allows programmers to access all data objects stored in archives (files) of entire framework. These data objects constitute framework database including user profile, item profile, rating matrix, context template, context, etc. Each archives (file) is called unit representing a CSV file, database table, Excel sheet, etc. Such database has the schema. Please distinguish such framework database schema from context template schema because the framework schema contains template schema.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • getCTSManager

        CTSManager getCTSManager()
        Provider manipulates context and context template via context template schema manager (CTS manager) represented by CTSManager. This method returns the internal CTS manager of the provider.
        Returns:
        CTSManager

      • getConfig

        DataConfig getConfig()
        Provider is initialized (set up) based on the configuration. This method returns the configuration of provider.
        Returns:
        configuration of provider.

      • getAssoc

        ProviderAssoc getAssoc()
        Provider uses provider associator represented by ProviderAssoc for low-level data operators. The method returns the internal provider associator of this provider.
        Returns:
        internal ProviderAssoc of this provider.

      • getConfigProfile

        Profile getConfigProfile(java.lang.String att)
        Each provider has a configuration and store such configuration in unit as profiles. This method returns the profile of built-in configuration as profile, given attribute.. Each configuration profile has an associated attribute. Note, Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file).
        Parameters:
        att - specified attribute.
        Returns:
        profile of built-in configuration, given specified attribute.

      • insertConfigProfile

        boolean insertConfigProfile(Profile cfgProfile)
        Each provider has a configuration and store such configuration in unit as profiles. This method inserts a new entry into the configuration as profile. Note, Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file).
        Parameters:
        cfgProfile - specified new entry of the configuration as profile.
        Returns:
        whether insert successfully

      • updateConfigProfile

        boolean updateConfigProfile(Profile cfgProfile)

Note, Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file).
        Parameters:
        cfgProfile - specified configuration.
        Returns:
        whether update successfully

      • getRatings

        Fetcher<RatingTriple> getRatings()
        Retrieving all ratings from rating matrix of framework database via a fetcher. Such ratings are represented by rating triples. Note, fetcher is the interface for iterating each item of an associated collection. Rating triple contains the rating that a user gives on an item.
        Returns:
        Fetcher of RatingTriple.

      • insertRating

        boolean insertRating(int userId,
                     int itemId,
                     Rating rating)
        Inserting a specified rating that a specified user gives on a specified item into rating matrix of framework database.
        Parameters:
        userId - specified user identification (user ID).
        itemId - specified item identification (user ID).
        rating - specified rating that a specified user gives on a specified item.
        Returns:
        whether inserting successfully.

      • insertRating

        boolean insertRating(RatingVector vRating)
        Inserting ratings in the specified rating vector into rating matrix of framework database. Note, rating vector represented RatingVector contains ratings. If rating vector is user rating vector, it contains all ratings of the same user on many items. If rating vector is item rating vector, it contains all ratings of many users on the same item.
        Parameters:
        vRating - specified rating vector.
        Returns:
        whether insert successfully.

      • updateRating

        boolean updateRating(int userId,
                     int itemId,
                     Rating rating)
        Update a specified rating that a specified user gives on a specified item.
        Parameters:
        userId - specified user identification (user ID).
        itemId - specified item identification (item ID).
        rating - specified rating that a specified user gives on a specified item.
        Returns:
        whether update successfully.

      • getUserAttributes

        AttributeList getUserAttributes()
        Getting attribute list of profiles of users in framework database. User profiles share the same list of attributes. Note, attribute represented by Attribute class indicates the data type, which is also a wrapper of data type. Attribute list represented by AttributeList is the list of many attributes. Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types.
        Returns:
        the same AttributeList that shared by user profiles.

      • getUserAttributeMap

        InterchangeAttributeMap getUserAttributeMap(int userId)
        Some user information is stored in outside database different from the framework database. This method is to used to retrieve such outside information via interchanged attribute map represented by InterchangeAttributeMap class. Note, interchanged attribute map includes both internal record and external record. Internal record represents a single-value record of a unit in framework database. External record represents a single-value record of a unit in other database (different from the framework database). There is a special unit (having name "hdp_attribute_map", for example) for storing many interchanged attribute maps;
        Parameters:
        userId - specified user identification (user ID).
        Returns:
        outside information of specified user, represented by InterchangeAttributeMap class.

      • insertUserProfile

        boolean insertUserProfile(Profile user,
                          ExternalRecord externalRecord)

Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file).
        Parameters:
        user - specified user profile.
        externalRecord - specified external record.
        Returns:
        whether insert successfully.

      • getRecommendParam

        RecommendParam getRecommendParam(int userId)
        Creating a recommendation parameter for a user identified by given user ID. This method reads framework database to receive ratings, list of contexts, user profile, and other information relevant to the specified user so that it creates a recommendation parameter for such user. The returned recommendation parameter is input for recommendation tasks; for example, it is input for methods estimate(...) and recommend(...) of Recommender class.
        Parameters:
        userId - specified user identification (user ID).
        Returns:
        recommendation parameter represented by RecommendParam class which is input for recommendation tasks.

      • getItemRatingVector

        RatingVector getItemRatingVector(int itemId)
        Getting a rating vector (a vector of ratings) of specified item. Note, rating vector represented RatingVector contains ratings. If rating vector is user rating vector, it contains all ratings of the same user on many items. If rating vector is item rating vector, it contains all ratings of many users on the same item.
        Parameters:
        itemId - specified item identification (item ID).
        Returns:
        rating vector (a vector of ratings) of specified item.

        Some item information is stored in outside database different from the framework database. Note, interchanged attribute map includes both internal record and external record. Internal record represents a single-value record of a unit in framework database. External record represents a single-value record of a unit in other database (different from the framework database). There is a special unit (having name "hdp_attribute_map", for example) for storing many interchanged attribute maps;
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        outside information of specified user, represented by InterchangeAttributeMap class.

      • getNominalList

        NominalList getNominalList(java.lang.String unitName,
                           java.lang.String attribute)
        Getting nominal list of specified attribute of specified unit. Note, nominal list represented by NominalList contains nominal (s). Nominal data indicates discrete and non-number data such as weekdays {Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday}. Nominal data is called nominal, in brief, represented by Nominal class. Unit represents a CSV file, database table, Excel sheet, etc. Unit is used to store object such as user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc. Attribute represented by Attribute class indicates the data type, which is also a wrapper of data type. If unit is database table, an attribute is identical to a field.
        Parameters:
        unitName - specified unit name.
        attribute - specified attribute.
        Returns:
        nominal list of specified attribute of specified unit.

        whether insert successfully

      • deleteNominal

        whether delete successfully.

      • getAttributeMap

        InterchangeAttributeMap getAttributeMap(InternalRecord internalRecord)
        Getting an interchanged attribute map by specified internal record. Note, interchanged attribute map includes both internal record and external record. Internal record represents a single-value record of a unit in framework database. External record represents a single-value record of a unit in other database (different from the framework database). There is a special unit (having name "hdp_attribute_map", for example) for storing many interchanged attribute maps;
        Parameters:
        internalRecord - specified internal record.
        Returns:
        interchanged attribute map by specified internal record.

      • getAttributeMapByExternal

        InterchangeAttributeMap getAttributeMapByExternal(ExternalRecord externalRecord)

Internal record represents a single-value record of a unit in framework database. External record represents a single-value record of a unit in other database (different from the framework database). There is a special unit (having name "hdp_attribute_map", for example) for storing many interchanged attribute maps;
        Parameters:
        externalRecord - specified external record.
        Returns:
        interchanged attribute map by specified external record.

        Returns:
        whether delete successfully.

      • deleteAttributeMap

        boolean deleteAttributeMap(java.lang.String internalUnit)
        Deleting all interchanged attribute maps by specified internal unit. Note, interchanged attribute map includes both internal record and external record. Internal record represents a single-value record of a unit in framework database. External record represents a single-value record of a unit in other database (different from the framework database). There is a special unit (having name "hdp_attribute_map", for example) for storing many interchanged attribute maps;
        Parameters:
        internalUnit - specified internal unit.
        Returns:
        whether delete successfully.

      • getAccount

        Profile getAccount(java.lang.String accName)
        Getting profile of account by account name. Note, Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file). Account is the information of a user who has access to the server with her/his previleges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile.
        Parameters:
        accName - specified account name.
        Returns:
        profile of account by specified account name.

      • validateAccount

        boolean validateAccount(java.lang.String account,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        int privileges)
        Checking whether an account is valid with regard to specified password and specified privileges. Note, account is the information of a user who has access to Hudup server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile. Account is the information of a user who has access to the server with her/his privileges. Account is modeled and stored in framework database as profile.
        Parameters:
        account - specified account name.
        password - specified password.
        privileges - specified privileges.
        Returns:
        whether the specified account is valid with regard to specified password and specified privileges.

      • getProfile

        Profile getProfile(java.lang.String profileUnit,
                   Profile condition)
        Getting profile from specified unit with specified condition. Note, Profile is one of important data structures, like record of table in database, has a list of values. Each value belongs to a particular attribute. Profile uses a attribute list to specify its data types. Every object can be modeled as profile to be stored in archive (file). Unit represents a CSV file, database table, Excel sheet, etc. Unit is used to store object such as user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc.
        Parameters:
        profileUnit - specified unit name.
        condition - specified condition to select profile to be returned, please see the net.hudup.core.data.Condition.
        Returns:
        profile read from specified unit with specified condition.

                             Profile condition)

        condition - specified condition to select profile to be returned, please see the net.hudup.core.data.Condition.

      • getUnitList

        UnitList getUnitList()
        Getting the list of units in framework database.       • createSchema

        boolean createSchema(AttributeList userAttList,
                     AttributeList itemAttList)
        Each database has a schema as the structure of such database. This method re-create the framework database by importing the other schema specified by given user attribute list and item attribute list. Note, provider allows programmers to access all data objects stored in archives (files) of entire framework. These data objects constitute framework database including user profile, item profile, rating matrix, context template, context, etc. Such database has the schema.
        Parameters:
        userAttList - specified user attribute list.
        itemAttList - specified item attribute list.
        Returns:
        whether create schema successfully.

      • dropSchema

        boolean dropSchema()
        Each database has a schema as the structure of such database. So this method drop the schema of current framework database, which means that destroying the framework database. Note, provider allows programmers to access all data objects stored in archives (files) of entire framework. These data objects constitute framework database including user profile, item profile, rating matrix, context template, context, etc. Such database has the schema.
        Returns:
        whether drop successfully.

      • importData

        boolean importData(Provider src,
                   boolean create,
                   ProgressListener registeredListener)
        Initializing this framework database by importing data from other database. The process of importing data is observed by the specified progress listener represented by ProgressListener. Programmers need to implement ProgressListener in order to specify how progress listener observes and does some tasks for the given process (importing data).
        Parameters:
        src - other provider that provides the other database.
        create - whether or not re-creating the current framework database.
        registeredListener - registered progress listener that observes the process of importing data.
        Returns:
        whether import data successfully

      • importData

        boolean importData(Dataset src,
                   boolean create,
                   ProgressListener registeredListener)
        Initializing this framework database by importing data from other database. The process of importing data is observed by the specified progress listener represented by ProgressListener. Programmers need to implement ProgressListener in order to specify how progress listener observes and does some tasks for the given process (importing data).
        Parameters:
        src - dataset of other database.
        create - whether or not re-creating the current framework database.
        registeredListener - registered progress listener that observes the process of importing data.
        Returns:
        whether import data successfully.

      • importData

        boolean importData(DataConfig src,
                   boolean create,
                   ProgressListener registeredListener)
        Initializing this framework database by importing data from other database. The process of importing data is observed by the specified progress listener represented by ProgressListener.         Parameters:

      • close

        void close()
        Closing provider, in which CTS manager and provider associator are closed too. All resources are released.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
